label: 検非違使
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: an agent of the Royal Police Office (Kebiishichô 検非違使庁), which was established as an extracodal agency in early Heian times to police the streets of the Heian capital. Its appointees were generally members of other guard units, such as the Right and Left Palace Guards (Emonfu 衛門府). By the tenth century, provincial police agents were also being appointed.
